New Records: England became the first men's team to hold the T20 and ODI World Cups simultaneously.
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes scored his first international T20 half-century.
Sam Curran was named player of the match and player of the tournament for his bowling performance.
Adil Rashid took two wickets and conceded only 22 runs, including a wicket maiden.
Shaheen Afridi took a brilliant catch to dismiss Harry Brook but injured himself in the process.
Naseem Shah bowled a remarkable spell of fast bowling that went unrewarded.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler hailed England's efforts and their strategy to push the boundaries.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The predicted downpour did not occur, allowing the match to proceed without interruption.
The match was held at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with an attendance of 80,462 people.
